alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 4:19PM EDT until September 09 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Wake County in central North Carolina... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 419 PM EDT, While rainfall has ended, several creeks and streams in and around Apex, Morrisville, and Cary remain at or above flood stage. The flash flood warning has been extended until these streams drop below flood stage. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, RDU International, Apex, Morrisville, William B Umstead State Park, Lake Wheeler, Research Triangle and Carpenter. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
